snippet: Two of the party bosses approached for support by George T. McDonald, who recently announced his run for the Republican nomination for mayor, have been charged in a corruption scheme.
abstract: New York City's Republican Party chairman Joseph J Savino and vice chairman Vincent Tabone are arrested and accused of involvement in what authorities say was attempt by State Sen Malcolm A Smith to bribe his way onto Republican line in city mayoral race.
lead_paragraph: Two of the party bosses approached for support by George T. McDonald, who recently announced his run for the Republican nomination for mayor, have been charged in a corruption scheme.

headline.seo: Transactional Politics for New York City’s G.O.P.
headline.main: A G.O.P. Candidate Heard His Party’s Message: To Run, You Pay
headline.print_headline: A G.O.P. Candidate Heard His Party’s Message: To Run, You Pay
